ygData.subject: Re: Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, personally When I am playing I am hunting.  I work FT and by the time I get on at night, we have to try and get together and do something before someone
ygData.messageBody:
Well, personally When I am playing I am hunting. I work FT and by the time
I get on at night, we have to try and get together and do something before
someone has to go to bed, the weekends are a different story. I do spend
time helping others out and going into town and such. I don't get much
time for "travel" and nice as it may seem to have a different outfit, My
group does not get items we do not need. There is enough camping for items
in the game now as it stands and for my group to camp a Mithril BP for me
"for looks" is not what we practice. I had a pair of ruby pants in the bank
but honestly i can't be bothered with carrying all that stuff around all the
time, just to impress people.
My point being, that if they we going to make items for us to increase our
wisdom stats I think the designers could have done a better job of trying to
make them match for our class specifically.
Also, just my opinion Human females look like ass in Steel plate and/or
bronze armor. Full ruby and Mithril and the mist armor I like, but the
others don't appeal to me what so ever.

Just My thoughts,
Bree
-----Original Message-----
From: AoS/Aosinator <darshan@...>
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, September 20, 1999 3:23 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Armor


>From: AoS/Aosinator <darshan@...>
>
>Bree,
>
>>Well, you are in the wrong class if you are big on looks my friend, until
>>you can get to PoF and get the Mist Armor.
>
>I'm not too sure I agree with this. With the options of storebought Steel,
>Rubicite and Mithril, you can come up with a very nice looking outfit for
>travelling and social occasions. Although I'd like to obtain Mist Armor
>myself, it's just not feasible at this time. However, you can be as vain
>(I'm very aware of how my character appears), as any other class.
>
>>You wanna be a good cleric? Mostly likely the answer is yes.
>>Then you will look like a newbie.
>
>Absolutely, during times of battle you will look like a nightmarish
>hodgepodge. However, outside of battle you can still wear your travelling
>clothes. I normally carry my mithril breastplate, as well as the rest of
>my outfit with me, so that when I'm not fighting, I don't look a mess. =)
>
>
>
